title: Battle for the ballot a burden on the pocket

title: Munnar hopes for stability after a term of defections, power struggle

title: Student leaders give a campus vibe for local body elections in Kerala

title: CP3 will retire at end of the season, sources say
content: Chris Paul will retire at the end of the season, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania. The 40-year-old future Hall of Famer is in his 21st NBA season.

title: Steelers' Heyward, Slay to play; Rodgers still iffy
content: The Steelers are expecting defensive tackle Cam Heyward (ankle) and cornerback Darius Slay (concussion) to play against the Bears. Quarterback Aaron Rodgers remains questionable with his broken left wrist.

title: Sources: Rams give LB Landman 3-year extension
content: The Rams have signed inside linebacker Nate Landman to a contract extension, his agency, SportsTrust Advisors, announced.

content: Ferran Torres scored a brace as Barcelona marked their return to the Nou Camp in style with a 4-0 win over 10-man Athletic Bilbao.

content: The Clippers are planning to have star forward Kawhi Leonard return to action in Sunday's road game against the Cavaliers, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Bengals QB Burrow won't be activated vs. Pats
content: Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow will not play Sunday against the Patriots, meaning Joe Flacco will make his sixth straight start.

title: Flagg outduels HS teammate Queen in career night
content: Cooper Flagg got a measure of revenge against former high school teammate Derik Queen, scoring 12 of his career-high 29 points in the fourth quarter to lead the Mavericks to a 118-115 win over the Pelicans.

title: Source: 49ers voided Aiyuk's guarantees for 2026
content: During training camp, the 49ers voided the guaranteed money in wide receiver Brandon Aiyuk's contract for 2026 because he had not been meeting the requirements of that deal, a league source said, confirming a report by The Athletic.

content: No. 7 Oregon is nearly a double-digit favorite at home against No. 15 USC, and the Ducks matchup up well against the Trojans' style of offense.

content: Will the Browns lean on the run in Shedeur Sanders' first start? Will Eagles-Cowboys come down to Jalen Hurts? Is Michael Wilson startable in fantasy?

content: The league has seen an uptick in blocked kicks, and ESPN's NFL Nation shares how players have done it.

content: Chelsea weren't at their best vs. Burnley and got an important win, but they will need a bit more when facing Barcelona and Arsenal next.

content: Liverpool were thrashed at Anfield by Nottingham Forest, and they were poor at both ends of the pitch.

content: Four UCLA players, including Lauren Betts, are now projected first-round picks. But Spain's Awa Fam is No. 1.

content: The Avalanche's reign atop the list continues, and the Blackhawks break into the top 10. Here's the full list.

content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

content: Eric Morris has tutored QBs from Patrick Mahomes to Cam Ward and John Mateer. How he mentors them is key to their successes and his.

content: Bachmeier has impressed with his talent and toughness, two traits honed through years of family battles.

content: If bye weeks or injuries have you seeking lineup help, consider the Cardinals passing game and a sneaky defense.

content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Kane, √Ålvarez as Lewa replacement
content: Barcelona have lined up Harry Kane and Juli√°n √Ålvarez as potential replacements for 37-year-old striker Robert Lewandowski. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Donald Trump Says He Has One Thing In Common With Zohran Mamdani
content: US President Donald Trump hosted New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani in the Oval Office on Friday, after the administration had repeatedly referred to the left-wing incoming mayor as a "communist".

title: PM Modi Announces New Trilateral Partnership With Australia, Canada
content: A new trilateral technology and innovation partnership between India, Australia and Canada was announced by PM Modi after a meeting with his Australian and Canadian counterparts on the sidelines of the G20 Leaders' Summit

title: 'You Have Votes, I Have Funds': Ajit Pawar's 'Threat' To Voters In Malegaon
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar set the cat among the pigeons while campaigning for local elections when he appeared to threaten voters, saying he would release funds he had promised only if all of his party's candidates were elected.

title: Ex-Brazilian President Bolsonaro Arrested Over Flight Risk
content: Brazil's federal police on Saturday arrested former president Jair Bolsonaro over suspicion he was plotting to escape and avoid starting a 27-year prison sentence for leading a coup attempt.

title: 21 Dead In Gaza As Israel, Hamas Trade Truce Violation Allegations
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said 21 people were killed and dozens more wounded in multiple Israeli air strikes on Saturday, as Hamas and Israel again traded allegations of violating the fragile ceasefire.

title: Mossad's Big Claim: Hamas Terror Network In Europe For "On-Command" Attacks
content: Israel's Mossad intelligence service has publicly alleged that Hamas has been cultivating an operational network across Europe, working through covert cells.

title: PM Proposes 6 New Initiatives At G20, Says Indian Values Can Drive Progress
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has proposed four new initiatives aimed at global development at the G20 Leaders' Summit in Johannesburg.

title: 37 Maoists, Including Senior Leaders And Young Women, Surrender In Telangana
content: The Maoist movement suffered a significant organisational setback on Saturday as 37 of its underground cadre, including top state committee members and a large contingent of young women, surrendered in Hyderabad.

title: "Trusted Orchestra": Army Chief On How Operation Sindoor Was Executed
content: Op Sindoor was a "trusted orchestra" where every musician played a "simultaneous or synergistic role", and that is how in 22 minutes, the Indian armed forces could destroy nine terrorist targets, Army Chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi said on Saturday.

title: 'Courage, Devotion, Honour': IAF's Tribute To Pilot Killed In Tejas Crash
content: A day after a pilot was killed when a Tejas fighter jet crashed during the Dubai Air Show, the Indian Air Force remembered his legacy as that of "courage, devotion and honour".

title: 8-Year-Old Boy Run Over By Speeding Car Driven By Minor In Gurugram: Cops
content: An eight-year-old boy was killed after being mowed down by a car here, police said on Saturday. The car which was also being driven by a minor dragged the child for around 20 meters before coming to a halt, a police officer said.

title: Could Reshape Indigenous Politics: Tipra Motha Chief On United Northeast Bloc
content: Less than a month since several parties in the northeast announced they will be forming the One North East bloc, Tipra Motha Party chief Pradyot Debbarma said on Saturday that the alliance has made substantial progress.

title: "We Know Our Limitations": Himanta Sarma On NDA Target For Assam Polls
content: The Assam unit of the BJP on Friday decided to contest the 2026 assembly elections in the state with its alliance partners and set a target for the NDA to win 103 seats in the 126-member House.

title: J&K Police Arrests Man In Connection With White Collar Terror Module Case
content: The Jammu and Kashmir Police's State Investigation Agency arrested a man on Saturday in connection with a 'white collar' terror module case, officials said.

title: Actor Vijay To Hold Outreach Programme, First After Karur Stampede Tragedy
content: Actor-turned-politician Vijay will on Sunday hold a people outreach programme, the first after a stampede at his September 27 rally in Karur killed 41 people.

title: Pendency, Promoting Mediation: Incoming Chief Justice On Top Priorities
content: Two days before he takes over as the Chief Justice of India, Justice Surya Kant has said the two main priorities for him in his 16-month tenure will be tackling pending cases in the judiciary and giving an impetus to mediation.

title: 13-Year-Old Jumps Off School Building, Father Blames Teachers
content: A 13-year-old student died by suicide after she allegedly jumped off the third floor of the roof of her school building in Maharashtra on Friday morning.

title: Watch: Bolero Collides With Truck, Flips And Lands Upright, All In 6 Seconds
content: A routine morning on the Gorakhpur-Varanasi highway turned frightening when a speeding Bolero slammed into a small truck on an overbridge and overturned.

title: Girl, 7, Sexually Assaulted On School Grounds, Given Injection By Man In Gujarat: Cops
content: A probe has been launched after a Class 2 girl was allegedly molested twice and given an injection' by a man on a school campus in Vijapur town of the district, officials said on Saturday.

title: Congress Forms Panel To Start Seat-Sharing Talks With DMK For 2026 Polls
content: Putting an end to weeks of speculation, the Congress has announced a five-member committee to initiate seat-sharing talks with the DMK in Tamil Nadu ahead of the 2026 Assembly election.

title: Madhya Pradesh HC grants interim stay on action against ancestral house of Al-Falah group chairperson
content: The Mhow Cantonment Board issued a notice on November 19 to remove "unauthorised construction" at the ancestral house of Jawad Ahmed Siddiqui.

title: Nomination of transpersons to contest from women‚Äôs wards accepted
content: The candidatures of Amaya Prasad and Arunima M. Kurup, fielded by the UDF in Thiruvananthapuram and Alappuzha respectively, were approved by the respective returning officers on November 22, 2025, thus paving the way for them to contest the civic polls

title: West Bengal SIR will cause the largest disenfranchisement of voters in history: activists
content: Political analysts, activists say SIR being used as a tool to ‚Äúreduce the electoral weight of the States where the BJP is not sure of its support‚Äù; claim it is a ‚Äúbackdoor entry‚Äù for the controversial NRC, CAA

title: Security in Srinagar improving, all measures in place to maintain peace: CRPF IG
content: The CRPF, along with the J&K Police, the Army and civil administration, is working jointly to ensure stability in the region, says Pawan Kumar Sharma

title: Watch: Sons, daughters and battle for political legacy: the Lalu Yadav family fallout
content: In this episode of Talking Politics, we will examine the gender angle in political parties with family legacies

title: Siddaramaiah meets Kharge on resolving impasse over Cabinet reshuffle, power sharing
content: There was no clarity on the outcome of the talks; Shivakumar too is expected to meet Kharge on Sunday

title: New labour codes lead to confusion over Karnataka‚Äôs minimum wage revision
content: The revision of minimum wages in Karnataka, last notified in 2017-2018, is overdue since revision has to be done once in at least five years. A draft on revision was issued in April, 2025

title: After poll drubbing, Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party dissolves all organisational units
content: In a statement, party spokesperson Syed Masih Uddin said new units will be formed in the next one and a half months.

title: How a police constable turned into a key conspirator in ATM cash van looting case
content: On the day of the incident, Annappa showed up at one of the checkposts that were set up to check vehicles, despite having no duty there

title: Parliament Winter Session: Bill on civil nuclear sector among 10 proposed legislations
content: A Bill that proposes to open up the nuclear sector for private players has been listed for introduction

title: Light to moderate rain likely in Rayalaseema as low-pressure area forms in the Bay
content: More time needed to get clarity on whether the depression would intensify into a cyclone, says IMD-Amaravati official

title: Money laundering: eight trusts with PFI links under ED scanner
content: Properties worth ‚Çπ67 crore were recently attached as part of an intensified investigation into the role of these trusts in  handling funds for the banned Popular Front of India

title: CJI-designate identifies chipping away at 90,000-strong arrears in Supreme Court as his first priority
content: Justice Surya Kant, in an informal interaction, said identification of core cases and forming Constitution Benches to decide them will also release thousands of other connected cases

title: Integrate service with professional excellence, Vice-President exhorts students
content: Sri Sathya Sai Institute of Higher Learning is a national model for its thrust on character building, discipline, spiritual grounding, and commitment to providing free education, says C.P. Radhakrishnan

title: Cruise season kicks off amid hopes of revival
content: A new addition to this year‚Äôs package tours is Kadamakkudy, which is fast emerging as one of the sought-after tourist destinations in Kochi

title: U.P. CM pushes for stringent action on infiltrators, directs officials to set up temporary detention centres in districts
content: The CM says national security remains top priority and any illegal activity will not be tolerated; 7 districts of U.P. share an open border with Nepal allowing free movement of citizens of both countries

title: Experts hail project to conserve natural resourses by involving communities
content: The Climate Adaptation and Resilience in Agriculture project is being implemented by Accion Fraterna-Ecology Centre in Anantapur district

title: Goddess rides Sarvabhoopala Vahanam and Swarna Ratham on sixth day of Brahmotsavam in Tiruchanur
content: Deity appears in Krishna attire as vibrant folk performances and day-long vahana sevas mark the celebrations

title: The four-footed warriors in the President‚Äôs Bodyguard
content: With Republic Day two months away, the troopers have begun the process of training and selecting the 50 to 60 horses who will participate in the parade, presenting a ‚Äúblend of discipline, tradition, and spectacle‚Äù

title: BLO association seeks higher compensation for deceased colleagues
content: The State government had announced a two lakh compensation for BLOs who died while performing duties of the ongoing Special Intensive Revision of the voter roll

title: BJP accuses Mamata of 'politics of appeasement' for denouncing SIR
content: BJP national spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia claimed Banerjee is "scared" of the ongoing special intensive revision (SIR) because it will expose the "infiltrators" that the ruling TMC has "nurtured" as its vote bank in the state

title: Pakistan behind Delhi car blast? CM Fadnavis says plan was to bomb 'every corner of India'
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis stated Pakistan, unable to win a direct fight, attempts to assert presence through proxy wars, citing the Delhi explosion. Fadnavis also said that had the previous government taken action like PM Modi-approved Operation Sindoor, the country would not have suffered terror attacks like Pahalgam, where 26 civilians were killed in Baisaran meadow.

title: PPF can make you a crorepati, but is it the right investment option for you? Explained
content: Unlock the potential to become a crorepati with disciplined Public Provident Fund (PPF) investing. This government-backed scheme offers tax-free returns and compounding benefits, making it ideal for long-term wealth creation. Discover who can open an account, investment limits, tax advantages, and how PPF compares to other popular investment options for a secure financial future.

title: $1 trillion squad: Musk, Zuckerberg, Pichai, and fellow billionaires break the internet
content: A digitally crafted image of tech giants like Musk, Zuckerberg, and Cook in a parking lot has gone viral, sparking a meme frenzy. Dubbed the '$1 trillion squad,' the picture humorously reflects 2025's AI race and billionaire influence. Its uncanny realism, despite being AI-generated, highlights the growing impact of synthetic media on culture and our perception of power.

title: You can‚Äôt ‚Ä¶: Google CEO Sundar Pichai tells employees in all-hands meeting
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has cautioned employees about an "intense" 2026, citing fierce AI competition and surging cloud demand. He addressed concerns about an AI investment bubble, emphasizing that underinvesting poses greater risks. Pichai assured staff of Google's strong financial footing and superior positioning to navigate market volatility and competitive pressures.

title: Wangchuk‚Äôs release tops Ladakh group‚Äôs demands to Centre
content: The Leh Apex Body (LAB) has submitted a draft proposal to the Centre, demanding general amnesty for climate activist Sonam Wangchuk and other detainees following the Sept 24 violence. This amnesty is deemed crucial for smooth continuation of talks, alongside demands for statehood and Sixth Schedule status for Ladakh.

title: Gill Injury: Batter likely to be out for the year; who will be India's captain?
content: Captain Shubman Gill is set to miss the upcoming South Africa ODI series due to a serious nerve injury, potentially sidelining him until next year.  KL Rahul or Rishabh Pant might lead the team temporarily.  The selectors are also considering Abhishek Sharma and a pace attack featuring Akash Deep, Prasidh Krishna, Harshit Rana, and Arshdeep Singh.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to employees in internal memo: Google‚Äôs AI success can create‚Ä¶
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledged Google's AI advancements could temporarily impact the company, but expressed confidence in catching up.  Despite ChatGPT's user engagement cooling, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, emphasizing OpenAI's strength to navigate competition from rivals like Google and Anthropic, even as Google benefits from cloud services.

title: These communication habits can make you highly likable at work, says expert
content: People who are widely liked at work often rely on subtle communication habits that shape how others perceive their warmth and professionalism. Small behaviours, from a sincere greeting to confident vocal inflection, can strengthen rapport and build credibility. Experts note that making time for small talk and recognising when to step back from disengaged conversations also deepens trust and improves workplace relationships.

title: Final Salute: IAF shares send-off video for Wing Commander Syal‚Äî watch
content: The Indian Air Force mourns Wing Commander Namansh Syal, who tragically died in a Tejas jet crash at the Dubai airshow. A video tribute showcased a solemn send-off, honoring his dedicated service and exceptional skill. This incident marks the second Tejas crash in under two years, raising concerns about the indigenous aircraft's safety record.

title: From Patangarh to Japan: Gond art that became Jangarh Kalam ‚Äî and the boy who carried it to the world
content: In the early 1980s, Jangarh Singh Shyam's art on a mud wall in Patangarh village was recognized as contemporary art by J Swaminathan. This led to the global emergence of "Gond painting," though many insist on calling it "Jangarh Kalam" to honor its individual creator and revolutionary style.

title: Stefon Diggs' lady love Cardi B raves about hospital stay after giving birth
content: Rapper Cardi B shared her positive hospital experience after giving birth. She praised the food and treatment, joking about getting pregnant again soon. Fans reacted to her comments online. Cardi B is preparing for her upcoming tour in February 2026. Her album 'Am I The Drama' was released on September 19.

title: LiAngelo Ball Goes Platinum with Breakout Hit ‚ÄúTweaker‚Äù Featuring Drake
content: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.

title: Ciara on Russell Wilson: His maturity and 'fullness as a man' define their marriage
content: Singer Ciara revealed on the 'Angie Martinez IRL' podcast that her husband, Russell Wilson, despite being younger, acts as an emotional anchor due to his 'old soul' and maturity. She finds his grounded demeanor provides stability amidst NFL pressures and fame.  Ciara emphasized his 'fullness as a man' enriches their strong partnership.

title: Struggling with low haemoglobin? 7 easy ways to increase its levels in the body
content: Maintaining healthy hemoglobin levels is vital for oxygen transport and overall well-being. Consuming iron-rich foods, vitamin C, folate, and B12, along with beetroot and pomegranate, supports hemoglobin production. Avoiding iron absorption blockers and staying hydrated are also crucial. Regular aerobic exercise further boosts red blood cell production and oxygen-carrying capacity.

title: Who is Tatiana Schlossberg? JFK‚Äôs granddaughter who says she has a year to live
content: Tatiana Schlossberg, the granddaughter of the late President John F. Kennedy, shared a heart-wrenching personal story revealing her terminal cancer diagnosis. At just 35 years old and a devoted mother of two, she now faces a devastating prognosis following the discovery of a rare mutation of leukemia that emerged after childbirth.

title: 'Supari-killer mindset': TMC leader's 'Babri replica' remark sparks row; Cong, BJP react
content: A Trinamool Congress MLA's announcement to lay a foundation stone for a "Babri Masjid" replica in West Bengal on December 6 has ignited a political firestorm. The BJP and Congress have strongly condemned the move, accusing the TMC of stoking religious tensions and engaging in vote-bank politics ahead of elections.

title: 50k votes per seat to go? Akhilesh‚Äôs big SIR charge; claims EC, BJP targeting UP, Bengal
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav accused the Election Commission and BJP of colluding to remove over 50,000 votes in constituencies won by INDIA bloc parties during the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. He alleged this targeted political preparation, using the Special Intensive Revision exercise, is focused on Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal. And urged citizens to verify their voter enrollment.

title: Ashes: SRK‚Äìinspired meme! Ex-India batter mocks Vaughan
content: Former Indian cricketer Wasim Jaffer has again teased Michael Vaughan. This follows England's recent loss in Perth. The two former players share a long history of banter. England's aggressive Bazball approach faltered. Australia secured a comfortable victory. The series is now 1-0 in Australia's favor. England faces criticism ahead of the next match.

title: IND vs SA: Gill set to miss ODIs; leadership vacuum hits Indian cricket
content: India face a leadership crisis for the South Africa ODIs with captain Shubman Gill ruled out and vice-captain Shreyas Iyer already sidelined. A stop-gap captain will be picked from KL Rahul, Axar Patel and Rishabh Pant. With an overly right-handed batting core, selectors are also considering left-handed options like Pant, Tilak Varma and Washington Sundar to rebalance the middle order.

title: Cardi B turns newborn‚Äôs umbilical cord into gold pendant in bold tribute
content: Cardi B commemorated her fourth child's birth by transforming her umbilical cord into a gold pendant and her placenta into vitamins. This unique practice, offered by Mommy Made Encapsulation, also includes creating a "Tree of Life" placenta print. The service aims to preserve the initial bond between parent and child, a trend embraced by other celebrities.

title: 'You have votes, I have funds': Ajit Pawar's warning to voters sparks row; oppn reacts
content: Maharashtra deputy CM Ajit Pawar has ignited a political controversy by stating that voters have votes while he has funds, promising financial support if his party's candidates are elected in Malegaon. He warned of rejection if voters did not back all 18 NCP candidates, drawing sharp criticism from the opposition for allegedly threatening voters.

title: Ashes: Chasing Tendulkar's all-time record, Root flops again in Australia
content: Joe Root endured a disappointing start to the Ashes 2025 in Perth, failing to score in the first innings and managing only eight in the second, with Mitchell Starc claiming his wicket on both occasions. Despite his stellar career record, Root has historically struggled in Australia. Travis Head's century secured an eight-wicket victory for Australia in the first Test.

title: Hold your breath! 'Air-mergency' of living in one of the world‚Äôs most polluted cities
content: Millions in India's capital face a persistent health hazard from air pollution, with sustained high levels of PM2.5 linked to severe respiratory, cardiovascular, and neurological damage.  This daily reality, especially during winter smog, significantly reduces life expectancy and disproportionately affects vulnerable populations, demanding systemic emission control.

title: Parliament expected to introduce HECI Bill: How it will impact institutions
content: The Higher Education Commission of India (HECI) Bill, set to be introduced in Parliament‚Äôs winter session, proposes a single regulator to replace the UGC, AICTE, and NCTE. Focused on regulation, accreditation, and professional standards, HECI aims to streamline governance, enhance academic quality, and improve global recognition, while funding and select professional colleges remain outside its scope.

title: Ashes: Australia thrash England; skipper Stokes calls Oz player 'train'
content: England captain Ben Stokes expressed shock after a two-day defeat to Australia in the first Ashes Test. Despite a strong bowling performance, Travis Head's century proved decisive. Stokes emphasized the need for the team to process the loss quickly and avoid carrying any "baggage" into the next match in Brisbane.

title: J&K: Man arrested in connection with 'white collar' terror module in Srinagar
content: Authorities in Jammu and Kashmir have intensified searches across hospitals and media offices as part of a widening probe into a "white-collar" terror module. The investigation, sparked by the recovery of explosives and arms, has led to arrests and scrutiny of medical staff and a media house for alleged links to extremist networks and fugitive operatives.

title: 'We won't shut down': Al-Falah University assures worried parents; campus under ED lens
content: Al-Falah University assures parents it won't close amid regulatory probes and financial investigations. The Enforcement Directorate is probing alleged fund diversion and financial irregularities, leading to the arrest of the group's chairman. The university addressed a NAAC notice regarding outdated accreditation on its website, calling it an oversight.

title: 'The whole nation will go at them': Hussain fumes as England face loss
content: Travis Head's explosive 69-ball century powered Australia to an eight-wicket victory over England in the opening Ashes Test.  Pace bowlers Scott Boland and Mitchell Starc triggered an England collapse, setting up a chase Australia comfortably achieved on day two. Head's remarkable knock, despite opening due to an injury, was the highlight of a swift Australian win.

title: 'Will Rahul get msg?': BJP on Tharoor's Trump-Mamdani remark; calls Cong 'sore loser'
content: The BJP has questioned Rahul Gandhi's receptiveness to democratic cooperation after Shashi Tharoor lauded US political civility. Tharoor's post, advocating for post-election unity for national interest, drew a sharp retort from BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawala, who questioned if Gandhi would heed the message and avoid acting like 'sore losers'.

title: Watch: PM Modi on charm offensive at G20; shares laugh with Meloni, hugs world leaders
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's candid conversation with Italian PM Giorgia Meloni captured attention at the G20 Summit sidelines in Johannesburg. The Indian Prime Minister also shared warm embraces with other world leaders, including Brazil's President Lula da Silva. Modi's arrival was marked by a vibrant cultural welcome from a troupe and the Indian diaspora.

title: 'Detention centres in every district': CM Yogi cracksdown on 'infiltrators'
content: Uttar Pradesh's chief minister, Yogi Adityanath, has directed district officials to crack down hard on anyone illegally residing in the state, stressing the importance of maintaining order and safeguarding national security. Plans are in motion to set up temporary holding facilities for these identified individuals while arrangements for their removal are made.

title: 2nd Test: Kuldeep shines with three wickets; SA 247/6 at stumps on Day 1
content: India seized control on day one of the second Test against South Africa, ending at 247-6. Kuldeep Yadav starred with three wickets, while Tristan Stubbs and Temba Bavuma built a vital partnership. Despite a strong start from the openers, India's bowlers fought back, with bad light halting play. The tourists aim for a historic series win.

title: Failed coup bid: Brazil's ex-prez taken to prison; will serve 27-year jail term
content: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has been arrested. He was taken into custody on Saturday. This comes days before he was due to start a 27-year prison sentence. The sentence is for leading an attempted coup in 2022. Federal police acted on a Supreme Court directive. Bolsonaro was moved from his residence to police headquarters.

title: Dubai Tejas crash: Pilot Namansh Syal seen smiling with officials before tragedy ‚Äì video
content: An Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed during an aerobatic display at the Dubai Airshow on Friday, resulting in the death of pilot Wing Commander Namansh Syal. The aircraft reportedly failed to recover from a negative-G turn, plunging to the ground and erupting in flames. This marks the second crash of the Tejas fighter since its induction.

title: Rhodes attacked, AJ joins Rhea's War Games team
content: "SmackDown" was about teams that thrive and survive as Survivor Series: War Games approaches . AJ Lee is officially the fifth and final member of a group that includes Rhea Ripley, Alexa Bliss, Charlotte Flair and Iyo Sky .

title: Dumped by Trump: MTG, once a MAGA megaphone, quits Congress; faultlines exposed
content: marjorie Taylor-Greene bailed out of congress after a bitter public fall out with the president . she irked him by demanding the release of the Epstein files and contesting his claims of an improving economy . the three-term representative from the 14th district - a deep-red rural stronghold north of Atlanta - is also the party supremo .

title: Op Pathshala: J&K police interact with Darul-Uloom students in Ganderbal
content: senior police officers interacted with students and faculty of darul Uloom . officials briefed students about "various harmful influences that can mislead youth," urging them to make informed and responsible choices . police reiterated their commitment to fosteria .

title: Indian-origin Shumeet Banerji quits BBC board
content: board non-executive director Shumeet Banerji resigned from his post in the wake of the doctored Trump scandal . he said there are governance issues at the top of the corporation . his resignations were sparked by a leaked internal memo by Michael Prescott .
